æœ‰æ’è¬›
Amazing Stories
Apple partnered with Amblin Television and NBC Universal TV to create new episodes of sci-fi series Amazing Stories,

Untitled morning talk show drama
This will be a morning talk show drama starring Reese Witherspoon, Jennifer Aniston, and Steve Carell.

Space drama
Apple picked up an untitled space drama developed by Ronald D. Moore,and stars several actors including Joel Kinnaman.

Are You Sleeping
It will star Octavia Spencer, known for Hidden Figures, and Aaron Paul from Breaking Bad.

Home docuseries
Apple has ordered 10 one-hour episodes of the Home docuseries, which is produced by Matt Tynauer and Corey Reese of Altimeter Films.

See drama
. It's written by Steven Knight, known for Peaky Blinders and Francis Lawrence, known for The Hunger Games franchise, and will star Jason Momoa in the lead role of Baba Voss, a warrior, leader, and guardian.

You Think It, I'll Say It Comedy comedy
hort story compilation by Curtis Sittenfeld

Untitled drama series from Damien Chazelle
drama series from La La Land creator Damien Chazelle

Little America
It's written by Kumail Nanjiani and Emily V. Gordon, known for The Big Sick, and Lee Eisenberg, who is known for his work on The Office.

Swagger
based on the life of NBA star and Golden State Warriors player Kevin Durant.

M. Night Shyamalan thriller
Apple ordered a psychological thriller written by Tony Basgallop and produced by M. Night Shyamalan

Central Park animated musical
Central Park an animated TV series developed by Loren Bouchard, It stars Josh Gad, among others.

Isaac Asimov's Foundation
Apple is working on a TV series adaptation of the popular sci-fi series Foundation written by sci-fi author Isaac Asimov.

Emily Dickinson
Apple picked up a show about the life of famous American poet Emily Dickinson, set to be played by Hailee Steinfeld. Jane Krakowski, will also star as Emily's mother.

Little Voices dramedy
Little Voices is a half-hour dramedy from executive producers JJ Abrams and Sara Bareilles.

Shantaram
TV adaptation of Gregory David Roberts' 2003 novel Shantaram, which focuses on a character named Lin, a convict that escapes an Australian prison. American Hustle screenwriter Eric Warren Singer will serve as showrunner and executive producer.

Hilde Lysiak drama
Apple ordered 10 episodes of a drama series about Hilde Lysiak, a child journalist who publishes a newspaper in her hometown in Pennsylvania. Child actress Brooklyn Price will star in the show.

Calls horror
Apple ordered an English-language adaptation of French series Calls. It's a short-form series that tells stories based on snippets of audio taken from real-life situations. Many episodes fall into the horror and mystery sub-genres, and will likely use minimal visuals.

Pachinko
Apple secured the rights to create a TV show based on Min Jin Lee's novel Pachinko, which follows the lives of four generations of a poor Korean immigrant family in Japan staring in 1911. It will be written and produced by Soo Hugh, who is best known for The Killing.

Rob McElhenney and Charlie Day video game comedy
Apple has ordered a half-hour scripted comedy show created by Rob McElhenney and Charlie Day, who are best known for popular comedy show It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia. The show is set in a video game development studio, and McElhenney will be one of the show's stars.

Losing Earth Climate Change Project
Apple purchased the rights to develop a New York Times Magazine story (Losing Earth: The Decade We Almost Stopped Climate Change). It covers the 10-year period from 1979 to 1989, when "humanity settled the science of climate change and came surprisingly close to finding a solution."

Defending Jacob drama
Apple picked up drama series Defending Jacob, which will star Chris Evans, known for his roles in Captain America and The Avengers. It's a thriller based on William Landay's bestselling novel and covers the murder of a 14-year-old boy and his friend and suspect Jacob.
